petri.api
Class GameImage

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      petri.api.GameImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimatedImage, DualResolutionGameImage
public class GameImage
extends java.awt.Component

The base class for all Images used in the game. Generates a pixel-perfect outline of the Image by determining boundaries as a change between an alpha (transparant) pixel and a non-alpha (color) pixel. As such, this method is only accurate in determining the actual image contained in a .png. User must override to support other edge-detection methods if they want pixel-perfect collisions for other image formats, or .pngs with non-transparent backgrounds.

Author:
Cody Swendrowski
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

generate

protected void generate()
Generates an outline from the Image by determining pixel color and comparing to surrounding pixels to determine an edge.

removeExtraPoints

protected java.awt.Polygon removeExtraPoints(java.awt.Polygon poly,
                                             float radianVariance)
Calculates the angle differential between consecutive line segments of a Polygon. If the difference is less than radianVariance, it does not add the point between those two line segments into the new Polygon. Every other point is added, and the newly built Polygon is returned. This leads to faster collision checking. Written by Dan Miller

Parameters:
poly - Polygon to remove extra points from
radianVariance - Amount one point has to be apart from the other to save itself from being removed, in radians
Returns:
The simplified Polygon
